2_DPZv1DN4TqBsm69rRDzw.text: An idea as great as simple. Hummus and a topic you can choose (cold or hot) with freshly baked pita. In London there are countless places to go when you are hungry, but Hummus bros. is something extraordinary. Probably because they haven't really competition. Until now they are quite unique and the idea is perfect, because hummus is indeed something you can just eat everyday without getting bored (as they make different topics, dependent on the season). I tried chicken and lenses - both were delicious! I also loved the drinks (ginger lemonade with mint or fresh aloe vera with grapes, also a homemade limonade) which were really yummie and well measured. Funnily enough while checking the card and deciding what to drink the waitress suddenly asked: "Are you German?" I (uncertain, disappointed in my accent): "Yes..." She: "Also können wir uns auch auf deutsch unterhalten." She heard us talking german before. Obviously she was a student from Berlin. Cool coincidence. Anyway Hummus Bros are great! Everybody who wants a bit oriental-big-city-flavour should eat here. The prices are ok and the drinks are great. Also perfect for vegetarians! The paper instructions/analysis about the way you eat hummus and therefore your character are hilarious! The Berlin waitress gave us some as a souvenir. Also it was a great distraction while waiting in the airy room for our meals to come.

z1qWBAWPEY1EKTt9v2zGlw.text: YUM. have to come back. and so quick. would come back. not a 4 star cuz i like hummus to be tangy- kind of sour? this one isn't and get sick of it about half down the tub.

jgWEKnjCaG_z3d_otepItQ.text: I've been to this Hummus Bros on two separate occasions. I was pleased with my chicken dish the first time and decided to come back for more. The curry lamb special caught my eye, so I thought I should give it a shot.The dish was pretty underwhelming. I'm a big fan of lamb, and the flavour just didn't come through all the way for me in this dish. Beyond that, the curry wasn't very spicy, which only leaves a strangely bland taste.That said, the regular portion is substantial -- certainly enough for a meal on its own considering the pittas served with it. I wouldn't recommend buying the baklava -- although it's tasty, I think the portion is too small to justify the price.

syMz3Xzt8imPLwPzrf33OA.text: You are provided with a dish of houmous and lots of pittas. What you get to decide is the topping that comes with it. My personal favourite is the beef. I never really thought it would compliment the houmous, but It was darn tasty. The pittas are delicious! Wholemeal and fluffy, I think they make a great addition to the meal. Don't be fooled into thinking that you need to order lots of food because the dishes arn't too big. The food is really really REALLY filling. The side dishes are worth trying too. The aubergine is an aquired taste. My friends didn't like it, but I loved it. A real smokey taste. The only problem I had is the seating. Everyone is arranged on benches, which normally i wouldn't have a problem with, but we were sitting RIGHT next to some very loud people, who were slightly inconsiderate to everyone around them. I think we were just unlucky this time. Not too expensive either. 5 stars!

ecW_WojCzsIofBsvS46Xfw.text: Pretty good houmous and a good choice of toppings. The portions a pretty big too!!

7itLUu-A1BZoeoAaLkmCLg.text: I haven't been inside as this seems to be the lunch run place from work and someone always picks up my order.  I love my bowl of hummus and a topping--so far have had chicken and the vegetables.  I just wish you could mix it up a bit--I would have loved to have my chicken WITH the vegetables.  It seems like you are a bit locked into their options.  And some of the options to me sound gross.  I am sorry, but hummus and guac?  Really?  The hummus is good (although sometimes really strong on the tahini) and it is good and filling with a nice warm doughy pita pocket to go with.  I do want to check out the space--looks nice from the outside.

MAZItgeEytIc09hY4pUIwg.text: great lunch time bites.  good price point and easy take away.

En2MTfB3Fm_4D96cZuHtAw.text: Love this place! We found it after a few days of otherwise greasy food and the light yet filling food here was delicious! On top of the great food the service was incredibly friendly, as it was our first time the girl at the register was very helpful and explained how it all worked. Brilliant! Please open one in Davis California!

ky0ctprZHp4kj9jzP3I2Dg.text: fast service, was what I wanted on a whim. hummus is good but missing the super creaminess that is hard to replicate. I had mine with chicken and feta. they offer non gluten stuff if you don't want pita like carrot sticks or tortilla chips. free wifi and student discount 11-12 and 2-9pm. all in I paid £8.60 with lemonade. easy and fast lunch.

cTrMDydt0g97AFQpL4H2mQ.text: Hummus is a lebanese starter or side dish. It is a paste made out of chickpeas and some other ingredients. Hummus Bros is a bar with hummus as the main thing on the menu. The food was great and the hummus was lovely aswell. However, I must say that, when I eat oriental food, i like to have the entire oriental experience to go along with it. I like the decorations to be very oriental and the music aswell. Hummus Bros was a good place, however it did not really reach my oriental standards. Pro's: OK food, nice decoration, modern, clean and simple Con's: No oriental feeling

iUM1K9xx8irl-n8xMhoE7g.text: This is one of my favorite places to frequent near the base of operations at Queen Square, and its earned that reputation not just for its food and drink, but also because the staff are incredibly nice.  When I first moved to London, I was staying at a nearby hotel, and every time I walked into Hummus Bros., they remembered who I was and offered me free tastes of different things on their menu.  For this reason, I have actually tried nearly everything on the menu.  The hummus is delicious and very basic, allowing customers to add their lemony and garlic-y goodness to their personal taste.  It is served with toppings like delicious fresh guacamole, heavenly marinated mushrooms, and various meat options.  The pita are deliciously warm and soft, and there is ample pita for the hummus and the fork - wittily referenced on their place mats.  The tabouleh salad is crisp and very, very flavorful.  All of the servings are more than ample, especially considering the low price and frequent buyer card.  Not to be overlooked, the drink selections are quite a pleasant surprise as well.  I am pretty sure this restaurant must buy fresh mint by the crate, because their mint tea is literally fresh mint with hot water and the mint and ginger lemonade is surprising and refreshing.For me, this restaurant corners the market on quick, healthful, fresh and inventive food made with quality ingredients that make up a meal you feel good eating, whether you sit in or grab and go.

Snka428NRrGaTZJ1-_KBxA.text: Had Lunch here today with some work mates we had the lamb, chicken and falafel stuff It was actually quite nice I'm addicted to Hummus at the moment however they give you chilli and lemon and garlic separate here.. so you have to dress to your liking! .... Here.. they surround your dish with hummus so I did have a bit of sauce overload but it was cool.. Hot spiced apple drink was lovely and we were given Mint Tea on the house.. also lovely.. So we'll be back!....

xpQTEHTt71Bl1XJtP5WfXg.text: I like this place. Not because it's great, because it's easy.. I've had better hummus to be honest, but there are not too many places like this. The pitas are good though and worth the trip alone. The standard toppings give you a good variety of options and they have weekly special toppings.. None of which, I have to say, are particularly great quality. The prices are probably quite steep for what you get but the service is excellent - staff always seem happy to be there and are polite and courteous. Reading back, this sounds like quite a negative review, and I don't really mean it to It's a good place to go when you don't want to think too much but know you're going to fill a hole.

A-C9TYaD25lUSybHGn5sdA.text: With all the various hummus places around this place had very average hummus.  I never thought too much hummus could be a bad thing- but in this case it was too much average hummus with too little pita.

rNz_Nhl1oy_qbvNRhDD1GQ.text: I really want to give Hummus Bros more stars because I love the whole idea behind the cafe, the staff are so, so nice and the restaurants are attractive, but I'm afraid the hummus just isn't that nice. The brainchild of two University buddies (who aren't actually brothers) Hummus Bros first opened in Soho and this is the second branch to appear. They are a very environmentally friendly business; recycling, using renewable energy for their electricity and even the menus are printed on recycled card, so I'm really pleased about all that, but the hummus just doesn't cut it.You can choose from a small bowl (around £4.50) or a large (around £5.50) with crudités, salads, or more substantial combinations all served with a nice fluffy, warm, wholemeal pitta bread. I tried the special of the day which was spicy meatballs. They pipe a huge, thick roll of hummus around the outside of your bowl and the rest of the food goes in the middle. I really found this to be too much, even though I love hummus it was more than you'd get in an entire shop bought pot and you wouldn't eat all that in one sitting would you! The thing I didn't like was that it's so smooth, for me it barely resembled real eastern hummus which is meant to be textured. The strangest thing though is that they don't add lemon or garlic, you get it in a little separate pot on the side, but pouring this on the top of your hummus makes it taste even stranger as this has to be mixed well during preparation to offer a subtle flavour. I guess one good point is that you wont stink of garlic for the rest of the day! Unfortunately this all means it tastes mainly of tahini, and is the same consistency, so after a while we both just began to feel queazy and left half of our small dishes. This restaurant has real potential, but they just have one major problem... their main ingredient. If you're a true fan of proper hummus I just can't imagine that you'd like the stuff they make here, it's rather like eating squirty cream out of a can instead of jersey clotted cream. It's such a shame because Hummus Bros is a nice place, but for now I'll stick to cafes like Maoz who although don't specailse in hummus have a much tastier recipe.

T8J4H8MkTxGS4-yCSskFcA.text: falafel. okay.  not wowed.  a bit overpriced--you could probably find more authentic and less expensive elsewhere in london.   but, a few highlights were the freshness of the food,  and complimentary mint tea.  i also enjoyed the chili sauce; oh that sauce. it was delightful and not too spicy.  honestly, it was the best part of the meal.  might come back with friends, but i certainly wouldn't return independently.  sorry.

w0eihoJFyXz-CALsKmdO3w.text: I don't really like this place. It just seems pointless to me. There's plenty of good hummus in London and what Hummus Bros has to offers doesn't taste any better than the rest (it costs a bit more though). On my visit, I made the mistake of trying their chunky beef topping and was kinda grossed out. It left a really yucky taste in my mouth that was hard to get rid of. Maybe if I had ordered something else, I wouldn't be writing such a harsh review. They certainly seem to have plenty of fans; I'm just not one of them.

1k6-70BVBNTKhmUl9q5dmQ.text: If you are a fan of hummus, you definitely have o pay a visit to this place where hummus plays a starring role on the menu. In fact, it is an active ingredient in every dish! They also do some mean drinks- especially fresh lemonades with mint and ginger which must not be missed. Almost the best part is the friendly welcome and service you receive (and the buttons they give you saying "give peas a chance!"). The last time I went, my friend ordered dinner while I just had lemonade as I had already eaten earlier. By mistake, they made two portions of my friend's order and offered the second to me at no price. This was followed by complimentary mint tea and great friendly service- they definitely have a fan in me!

LcE2uZNiMVpoMod_CX-TQg.text: Great hummus, nice filling options for a healthy lunch and quick service. The understairs coat rack is a nice touch for eat in dinners.

XqANko9oOn2wKJmhD6lMTA.text: If you are looking for something quick and tasty this is an excellent option. The Hummus is tasteful and you can get extra two sidings, chicken, lamb, falafel and tabule. There are two sizes and you can have it on a bow or as a wrap. And under 6 pounds you will have a nice and healthy lunch. I really recommend it.

7zT0irsqrLYqSEzFsVj07A.text: This place is a little bit odd.  The falafels were both soggy and hard at the same time. The place is conceptually nice, but you'd think a hummus place could make a decent falafel.

GdEZDEL46fpFDyvyEOH05g.text: Absolutely awesome. The food is freaking delicious - the chickpea plate was good (although it was drenched in olive oil) but I LOVE the falafel side dish and the chunky beef main dish - nice flavor and very tender. A great place to get a fast lunch or dinner if you are gluten-free, also, as most of the food is GF and they will substitute the pita for GF bread (dry but good for mopping up hummus), tortilla chips (weird with hummus but fabulous with the garlic/cilantro/tomato topping on the falafel), or carrot sticks. The grilled aubergine is smokey and garlicky - also really great with tortilla chips. Almost everything is vegetarian except for maybe 2 meat options. Definitely try the aloe juice - I'm now completely addicted and don't know what I will do when I go back home. :(  the mint-ginger lemonade is also incredibly refreshing.Two other great bonuses: free wifi!!! and student happy-hour discount where you get half-price drinks (non-alcoholic but a great deal) and half-price side dishes with your ID. Bottom line: awesome.

tSr2Z7bZi82f_TlnfTVi2A.text: Hummus Bros is a little bit of an odd fish  yes, they make a tasty healthy (I'm led to assume it's healthy  maybe it isn't?) fast food alternative, but it's just not that good. Something about the Soho branch compels me to overlook it, but the personality-free surroundings of the Holborn branch really drive the point home.If you wanted to have a pile of hummus and some carrot sticks and it wasn't chucking it down with rain you'd do far better to grab some from the nearby supermarket and go sit in the square  you'd have enough for 2 people, it'd be half the price, and the hummus would be nicer!To break it up a bit the hummus bowls can be topped with stuff, although based on my 5 or 6 tries at this they're all a bit forgettable.The place isn't actively bad, it's just not actively good. Far better lebanese food is easy to find, and cheaper better hummus exists at most supermarkets. Although you do get warm pita bread  maybe that's what all the fuss is about?Having said that, one of my best mates is obsessed with the place, so what would I know?

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Bros - London, United Kingdom

pgb6KGUW30Vg23zYwsS0lA.text: The place is good, but know what you're getting into....I was craving falafel and found this place by googling. I ordered a falafel wrap without thinking much about it. It came with the usual suspects, minus garlic/onions, plus pickles and tortilla chips on the side? I think the feeble attempt at what I assume to be Mexican fusion was really strange, and I hate pickles. And we're not talking assorted pickled vegetables, but actual pickles like you would put on a ham sandwich or something. My friend got the spicy wrap and it tasted like jalapeno, and you can add guacamole. I'm sure people like it, but I didn't expect it or want it.Anyway - besides that the food was good. Hummus is thicker than usual, more like a heavy paste. Quite good. Falafel was chunkier than usual but the texture and flavor are good. Yeah, it feels a bit expensive for a vegetarian meal but I've paid more for worse falafel in London...I'll go back. Supposedly there is a student discount as well.

5qQUBP9dMKf3KAU59EvOrA.text: Mmm... creamy hummus topped with fresh and crispy salad ingredients, covered in lemon garlic sauce, mixed with spicy pepper, with some olive oil to finish it off inhaled with warm fluffy brown pitta and fork results in one very happy and full Yelper.This Hummus Bros location sits in an old Georgian building next to Bloomsbury Way (Theobald's Road) on Southampton Row.  The inside is minimalist and swanky, with an impossibly high ceiling and a mezzanine level accessible to diners by means of a spiral staircase just at the front entrance, which provides a good area for larger groups.  According to their website, this area can be used for business meetings and is decked out with a projection wall, a sound system, comfy couches, and, of course, the place's free wifi.  Swish.The entire place's air of sophistication belies the lunch you are about to consume for under a fiver.During my afternoon visit, the counter person was pleasant and helpful.  The service was prompt.  The £3.80 I paid for my small vegetable bowl of hummus pleased me immensely.I had my laptop with me and would have taken advantage of the free wifi, but my hummus bowl so consumed me that I couldn't stand to divide my attention.FYI: Prices go up significantly after 5pm.  Weird.

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Bros - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hummus Bros - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hummus Bros - London, United Kingdom. from a website

YJfypbLFa87rs31GIWWp8Q.text: I'm not overly impressed with this place considering the gassed up reviews! The falafels were good but the 'falafel salad' was a bit of a rip off! they gave me two bits of pita bread which were free but I didn't ask for them and would have preferred more salad than them because the salad was tiny and I didn't want bread! very friendly staff on a positive! but very average hummus!!

NbmbZ9UATJ_g55Sq2Imiqw.text: I love, love, love Hummus Bros. I just need to put that out there. London is known for having bland, greasy, and overall lackluster cuisine. However, Hummus Bros. is the complete opposite of everything that food in London has been known for. The food at Hummus Bros is always fresh and full of flavor, and fairly priced! They serve each hummus dish with a side of lemon and garlic sauce, and the hummus itself is flavored just right. The meats are tasty and the garnishes are all mouth watering. It seriously makes it hard to eat hummus anywhere else. My favorite dish is the half-gaucamole, half chicken plate. Who knew that guacamole and hummus could go together so perfectly?!Every time I'm in London I make it a point to bring a new friend to Hummus Bros in hopes that they'll be just as hooked and continue the trend. It's a great place for anyone that enjoys a good, hearty meal. There are student discounts and there is also free wi-fi as well (which is actually quite hard to come by in Europe outside of McDonalds/Burger King).The only thing that is missing at Hummus Bros is alcohol!Give (chick)peas a chance!

NM4W6S5FuUmWbe35N9smdA.text: Went here after seeing Star Trek and it was a great repreive from the craziness in London. The space is very open and simple and the staff is attentive and helpful.The food is really tasty and filling.

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Bros - London, United Kingdom. Guacamole Hummous and Tabouli salad. Delish!

81FO9CyX4tabt0uzNhEVpQ.text: I ordered a regular size with chunky beef and avocado, and loved it!  I added some jalapeno peppers as well and it was just about perfect.  The hummus was great, the attitude of the staff was fun and the atmosphere was calming.  I went for lunch and it wasn't too crowded, but there were enough customers coming through the door that you knew the place had  a good reputation.The only real downside was that I had to order an additional two pieces of pita bread.  The hummus came with two pieces, but seriously, who enjoys that much hummus with two small pieces of bread?  The small hummus meal only came with one piece of pita bread, so my wife needed another piece, too.All in all this was a great pick for lunch.  Not too expensive, but the meal definitely filled  me up.  I ate so much that I didn't have dinner until later than normal.  I fully recommend this place.

tYwcL-i2Scp2Aj0ActGHlw.text: Such a solid idea!! Really great modern take away food but without the feel of fast food. Really tasty, really fresh. The hummus was so good i got another tub to take home.

LDmK0uH9BNqErvNxbzVfvA.text: Solid food and affordable. A hard combo to find in London. If you are visiting London for only a few days, I wouldn't say this place is a must, but if you live here or have plenty of time and want to save some dough, this might be a good option. The babaganoush was delish, and they have some good student discounts during specific hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Bros - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hummus Bros - London, United Kingdom. Student discounts

YLYc3r77PjHFaX6FCW0sAQ.text: I was so excited when I found this place on a lunch break from my study abroad class in London. What a great concept! I love hummas! And I love student discounts! Now hurry up and come to LA!

NjCxGZUXiZuRnEnxo72sIA.text: Best place for people/celeb watching. Nice menu. Delicious hummus, if a little garlic-less for me (you can add your own garlic oil, but it's not hugely satisfactory). They also have low-fat hummus, which is good. V filling! Good value.

r1qsDpXymg0dWyfh5BY0Wg.text: I love love love this place. I wish we had a Hummus Bros in the US - in NYC because I would go eat it everyday. It is absolutely delicious and very fairly priced. And the hummus was just absolutely excellent. Just writing this review makes me wish I was back in London, studying abroad, and running in between classes to get lunch at Hummus Bros.Only downside - it's so small and hard to find a seat, that I normally got take out and ate in the school lounge.

UtII1l7z8SF6tCA_DnDz4Q.text: Hummus Bros reminds me a lot of Hummus Place in the East Village. With that said, Hummus Bros doesn't really have much charm - the interior is basically a cleaner, higher-end fast food joint (very Chipotle-esque).The food here is pretty decent, though. I especially like the smoothness of the hummus and the umami flavor of the stewed chicken topping. Because a meal here is pretty much a bowl of hummus and some pita, I wouldn't recommend coming here unless you qualify for the student discount.

TsnMF4cu7_tICqgESt1xHA.text: A very pleasant find.  For vegetarians: Not all-veg but, as you mightguess from the name, very veg and vegan friendly.Oddly, the hummus itself -- their centerpiece -- is rather bland.  Buttheir fava beans (ful) is fantabulous.  The warm pita is tasty.The portions are large, so order the regular unless you're reallyhungry.  The staff, ambiance, etc. are all good and I'd gladly goback.

3cR9ulH62LXuodr4-9HQDQ.text: As a massive fan of hummus and chick peas of any variety, I was very much looking forward to trying this place out for the first time today. Although I won't say I was disappointed --there are a lot of options, even as a vegetarian, that I'd be willing to try on future visits -- I wasn't thrilled with their hummus recipe. The texture looked and felt almost whipped, and the colour strikingly grey, which I suspect is due to a larger ratio of tahini. The taste seemed to verify that - it had an exceptionally smoky flavour which at first bite was quite nice, but became almost sickeningly rich after subsequent mouthfuls.  Although I'm not a spice addict, I found myself dumping the entire bowl of cilantro/coriander chili sauce  onto my hummus plate to try to balance out the flavour. (I will say that the sauce was very tasty on its own). I do also agree with other reviewers that it's a very large amount of hummus, (topped with a basin of olive oil) even as a small portion, which makes me wonder at what point it ceases to become a "healthy" option...The mint/ginger lemonade was quite good (and the student discount even better). I imagine I'll go back sometime to try some of the sides and drinks but I can find hummus more to my liking elsewhere in the city. Otherwise, the menu is innovative, the prices are good, and the staff seems friendly so overall I'd recommend it, but if you are used to more of a chick-pea flavour in your hummus you might be a little disappointed. Menu items ordered: Small lunch reduced-fat hummus with vegetable salad topping. Mint and ginger lemonade

637o0p17kluxmDJoIsUy6w.text: Lovely food, lovely ambience. I'm almost always lost with the choices. Can't wait to go back and pay a visit.

Y7aBtmSbwVJrgvuOAefPCA.text: I was leaving the British Museum and on the lookout for a vegetarian friendly lunch, and decided on Hummus Bros. Everything was fresh and the staff was very helpful.The food wasn't quite up to the level of tiny, Israeli falafel shops, but the service was friendlier. Less flavorful than some other falafel I have tried, but it worked for us while visiting the area.

-iXhKE_H_eWgPxTKBwkUFw.text: Congratulations! You became one of my favourite restaurants in Holborn!Honestly, I am obsessed with their falafel and hummus! As other people have mentioned, I became so full even with a normal portion but it was moreish!!   My order for the first time was 'Hummus bowl with Chicken & Falafel salad' which was beautiful! The hummus salad was mild and creamy with rich sesame flavour. Then crunchy aromatic falafel and chicken gave a wonderful accent! Tender Tzatziki also helped to make a wonderful completion of the dish! For the second time, I finally ordered "Hummus bowl with Guacamole and falafel salad which was great as I expected!The restaurant is stylish and modern style on the wooden floor at the clean premises.I felt their passion into the brand (as you can see they put effort into the design of bags too!) and they select the ingredients carefully.

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Bros - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hummus Bros - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hummus Bros - London, United Kingdom

YOp32nTtQKrCa7iQt4NBag.text: I absolutely love this place. This is the place that made me actually like falafels. Every other place I've tried has been fine, but none have made me really keen on falafels. But then I went to Hummus Bros. The chicken and falafel salad is perfect. They have two sizes depending on how hungry you are or if you want to save some for later. The larger size comes with an extra pita slice and they toast the pita so its warm and soft for you even if its for take away. You can substitute the pita for rice cakes, carrot sticks, gluten-free bread, or corn tortilla chips. They also have a little chart on the front counter that states what items are vegetarian/ egg free/ gluten free/ soy free / peanut free, etc.....The falafels are so so so good and the hummus and toppings it comes with makes for a perfect and satisfying meal. I love having it with jalapenos, which do cost a little extra. I would crave Hummus Bros which would lead me to come here several times and I was satisfied with each visit. Oh and they have free wi-fi as a bonus

uGucUlsvwCNgV-lIjvb40g.text: Quality of food was great; service unfriendly and unhelpful.I thought the quality and taste of the hummus was spot on (could really get that taste of tahini/sesame in it, yum).  I got a large bowl with falafel and guacamole salad.  Both were nice as well -- funny to have dips on dips (guacamole on hummus), but tasted great!  And by the end of the large bowl, with two whole wheat pitas, I was really stuffed.  I'll go for the smaller bowl next time.The service wasn't good -- I was asking for clarifications about the menu, how the place works, etc. and was greeted with short, unhelpful answers.  For example, how long will the hummus in a tub last if I bring it home and keep it in the fridge?  Today only.  (doubtful...).  Do you offer student discount? No. (this is opposite of what one of the earlier yelp reviews said!).  Overall I left with a bad impression of the service, even if the food was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Bros - London, United Kingdom. take-away falafel and guacamole large hummus bowl, with two pitas: 6.45

CH8VyY3IoicOT_zlU5Zeig.text: i'm visiting London a lot more at the moment and being in a city i dont know means ive become more reliant of yelp for useful information. after a quick look at yelp to see what was nearby...up pops hummus bros.turns out its in my office building but on the side of the street i never walk down. WIN!clean, modern and industrial is how i'd describe it. Although mainly aimed at lunch time take out ( i think), it does have some seating. Menu is clear concise and not overly complicated or too many options. With this said i must have still looked a little baffled (probably because i wanted to eat it all) as the lovely lady on the till taking orders quickly jumped into action to help me through it. Excellent service. And continued as i had everything bagged and ready to go within 2 mins. FYI i ordred chicken & Guacamole hummus bowl, with pitta and a drink and a side of tabbouleh salad. £8. not bad for london, when i can get a sandwich and drink i dont like for £6+I'm now sat at my desk eating it and aside from the taboulleh perhaps requiring a little more lemon juice (which i expect is a personal preference) its a winner!! Really delicious and satisfying lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Bros - London, United Kingdom. Hummus bowl with chicken and guacamole. Tabbouleh salad on the side. Pita and drink 8
Photo of Hummus Bros - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hummus Bros - London, United Kingdom

PbBrSpzyISX_TZr6uq-bNg.text: I just don't think this is for me - and I love hummus! It's just too much liquid, hummus and guacamole and chicken in some other sauce... It's too much! They also forgot my pita which I didn't find out until I was back at my desk. Also they put red pepper in the guacamole- noooooo that's just horrible! It shouldn't be there! I won't go back.

9-3qwRJCJLjmAvWTAkDZoA.text: Went on a weekend trip to London and got the cravings for some good hummus.Found this place on Yelp. The hummus was nothing special and I didn't really fancy the decor of the restaurant.

qVw-yoIF7X6erdT0qfOUcQ.text: Had dinner here recently, but overall came away with mixed feelings. First, the place has a nice setup, with  a small ground floor quick service area set up with picnic style tables and a large upper floor. It was fairly busy when we went, with two large tour groups occupying the upstairs in succession. A server quickly took our order at the table, and the food came out within a few minutes, which was great.The portions are decent sized, especially as pita and hummus are quite filling. We got a large bowl and a wrap, and this was more than enough for two people to share. The hummus was delicious and the two warm brown fluffy pita was perfect to tear and dip. The wrap was pretty big, but stayed together nicely. Onto the negative: first, they got our bowl order wrong. We ordered chicken and guacamole, but were served chicken and falafel. We were hungry though and didn't want to wait for a new one so we didn't bring this up with staff. Second, the falafel had a delicious crunchy exterior but they were almost cold, which wasn't too appealing. Third, they added almost £7 to the bill, with an item apparently coming from a table that had already left. When we brought that up after paying they apologized and gave us £3 back, mystifyingly; we had to prompt again for the correct change. Fourth, the bathroom was pretty messy, with shreds of paper on the ground and the ol' watered down hand soap trick, which made it difficult to feel like you could wash your hands well - kind of important with this kind of cuisine. Fifth, to top it off, when we asked if there was a student discount, staff just said, "No." That was a bit disappointing considered how it's all over the yelp page, but also left us puzzled and no further information was given. So all in all, despite the genuinely delicious food, probably won't be heading back here. Too many little bothers came up and took away from the overall experience. That said, it seems very popular for large groups, probably for the location, space, fast and good eats, and decent price.

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Bros - London, United Kingdom. Chicken falafel bowl, falafel wrap!

ROD3qaClHf0TdxPhY_iOgg.text: While the United States seemingly has a hummus monopoly where one can find himself or herself dipping things into large tubs of Sabra hummus for any occasion, the United Kingdom does not. But the UK has dining places that specialise in freshly made hummus. As the hummus tub has been a party lifesaver for any American event, stuffing ones mouth with pre-made hummus is not the same experience as stuffing one's mouth with freshly blended and whipped chickpeas. It makes me sad that a place that specializes in homemade hummus only exists in the United Kingdom.The hummus is whipped into a cream-like texture. The hummus cream tastes slightly tangy, and nutty but well-blended with oil, chick peas and possibly garlic; and served with the freshest most fluffy pita bread imaginable. The hummus has such a fine flavor that has the quality of it being blended with egg yolk (though it is actually vegan.)My favourite part about this place is that table service is not compulsory. The hummus with pita could be eaten in any part of the two-story building but there is no waiter service on the ground level. Upstairs offers table service, with couches and a food elevator. It is a lot more quiet and business meeting-like up there. Three Tips:Tip 1:While the picnic table/communal table style seating fills up on the ground level very fast, takeaway is also an option and cheaper. Tip 2:Dinner prices are more expensive than lunch prices. Perhaps the more expensive the quieter? Takeaway for dinner, for example, is same price as eating in for lunch.Tip 3:Although this place is small and seating is limited, find another dining place in the area that offers free wifi!Tip 3 A:Credit cards are accepted.

A5uRHAZwR3gVlNyzqM7S6Q.text: Friendly service and good falafel! The humus was a bit bland but was fine with salt. Really cute place for sure.

MSqy2MrioLlRI5TiV3CV8w.text: I LOVEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE Hummas Bros. LoveLoveLove. I won't leave London without some. I get hummas with 'shrooms on top. There's a low fat hummas (minus the Tahini), but it gets gone quick!I was there twice last week. The first time, I was quietly reading and minding my business. A few annoying students decided to practically sit on top of my TUSH (I wanna say something else). Why not sit at the other bench or the stools??? They gave lame, meek apologies and proceeded with their loud and inane banter. Eventually I got up and moved my seat. I think the server felt badly because he came over and offered me a lovely mint tea on the house. Oh it was yummy. I had another.Love this place and if someone wants to go in with me, I'd open one in NY, DC and Miami!

vCNY0QIfPI2Adz8o_HBVyw.text: The hummus is good, and the sides are ok as well. It's still not as fantastic as most people say. Definitely worth a try is you never and the staff is really nice.But I can't say it's my favourite place.

nu4HrCuZAmrWB9t_YqWXmw.text: Nice food and great value! Hummus is nice but not the best I've tasted! Same with their tzatziki! Would recommend but not mad about it! Nice spot for quick eats!

photos.caption: Photo of Hummus Bros - London, United Kingdom. Half chicken, half beef, with pita, tzatziki and hot apple juice

4gw0KuFqWIMRYuv2hZ575Q.text: I think if you combined the different franchises of this single restaurant concept around London, you might actually find it to be one of the higher rating businesses, and certainly one of the strongest performers among 'chain-ish' restaurants. Certainly since my first visit, I've been back several times, and have converted several people by convincing them to 'Give Peas a Chance'... and they've all loved it.Hummus Bros does... hummus, unsurprisingly, but they do it very well. Warm pitas, fresh toppings, mmmmm. Also, a falafal salad I die for. And, a mint and ginger tea that never fails to refresh.This is a little slice of the Mediterranean that shouldn't be missed, among locals and visitors alike. Situated so well between Holborn and Russell Square stations, there's not excuse not to stop in.

W4QkLfpcF_0C0FwwWUgOhw.text: I had their plain hummus tonight and found it to be boring and lacking the traditional hummus flavors I was seeking. Honestly, the prepackaged hummus at the nearby Sainsbury's was tastier. I'll give credit though to the texture of the hummus here, which is very smooth and lovely. Perhaps their hummus dishes with the toppings are actually good, but I think I'll look elsewhere when I'm craving hummus.

F-QRiePOhKOpFHtbNiLw4Q.text: This is my local and I love it! It's close to campus, they have wifi and long chairs and student discounts... what more can a girl ask for? Lunch for under a tenner in this neighborhood? Yes, it can be done!I have been here many times, so I can say it's really well made hummus, everything taste really fresh. FOOD: My usual is the regular beef with warm cider, but the veg and chicken options are just as good. I will say that I wish they had more pitas, but I rarely ever finish mine, so I take it home for a late night snack, hence the regular over small. SERVICE: They guys here are really great too, and for first timers, patient and helpful. LOCATION: They have an upstairs location and for being so close to a busy intersection, it's a relatively quiet place to work, especially after the lunch rush. I highly recommend it as a place to break up the lunch monotony and keep with a healthy diet.

3m3g6_L7kLdhZcMb-CLd3Q.text: Whenever I go to one of their branches I always go for the Fallafel Salad Bowls. They are nice and big and really pack it in. It's also fresh and cheap. I always add some lamb too to the bowl for a bit more substance.

jD5cNeR4CShFnhijbRrC_w.text: A solid 4. The food is really tasty -- I had a hummus, chicken and falafel salad with sundried tomatoes and a pita. However it's slightly pricey for what you get -- I got the small portion and was disappointed this has one small piece of falafel and was mostly hummus. I only had one pita to eat all the hummus which wasn't enough. Still, it filled me up and tasted delicious. As Alex said, not a lot of places to sit here but great for takeaway. Service was really quick and I took my lunch over to Russell Square for a picnic.

_KUWh2YXqiaFUPkU5dht5A.text: This place blows. Out of guacamole, pita and carrots when i went. I upgraded to a "large" chicken/hummus bowl. Probably two pieces of chicken on top of a massive tub of just hummus for 8. Terrible experience.

gawSNqnhkxhxgthJVpCcIA.text: Not much to say. The food is really good and I'd go again. If you want Greek food & especially some hummus, go here.
